text: Psalm 69
A Plea for Deliverance from Persecution

For the \add music\add* director, according to \add The\add* Lilies. Of David.\f + \fr Ps 69 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
Save me, O God,
because waters have come up to \add my\add* neck.\f + \fr 69:1 \ft Hebrew “soul” or “life” \f*
I sink in \add the\add* mud of the deep, and there is no foothold.
I have come to watery depths,
and \add the\add* torrent floods over me.
I am weary with my calling \add out\add*; my throat is parched.
My eyes are exhausted \add in my\add* waiting for my God.
More numerous than the hairs of my head
are \add those\add* hating me without a cause.
\add Those who are\add* destroying me—my enemies wrongfully\f + \fr 69:4 \ft Or, “those who oppose me \fq with \ft falsehood” \f*— are mighty.
What I did not steal, I then must restore.
O God, ⸤you yourself know⸥\f + \fr 69:5 \ft Literally “you, you know” \f* my foolishness,
and my guilty deeds are not hidden from you.
Let those who wait for you not be put to shame because of me,
O Lord Yahweh \add of\add* hosts.
Let those who seek you not be disgraced because of me,
O God of Israel.
Because on account of you I have borne reproach;
disgrace has covered my face.
I have become a stranger to my brothers
and a foreigner to my mother’s sons,
because the zeal for your house\f + \fr 69:9 \ft Or “temple” \f* has consumed me,
and the reproaches of those reproaching you have fallen on me.
When I wept in the fasting of my soul,
it became reproaches for me.
When I made sackcloth my clothing,
I became for them a byword.
Those sitting at \add the\add* gate talk about me
\add as\add* also\f + \fr 69:12 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* \add the\add* songs of \add the\add* drunkards.
But as for me, my prayer \add is\add* to you, O Yahweh, for a favorable time,
O God, according to the abundance of your loyal love.
Answer me with the faithfulness of your salvation.
Deliver me from \add the\add* mud and do not let me sink.
Let me be delivered from \add those who\add* hate me
and from \add the\add* watery depths.
Do not let the torrent of waters flood over me,
or \add the\add* deep swallow me,
or the pit close its mouth over me.
Answer me, O Yahweh, because your loyal love \add is\add* good;
according to your abundant mercies, turn to me,
and do not hide your face from your servant.
Because I am in trouble, answer me quickly.
Draw near to my soul; redeem it.
Because of my enemies, ransom me.
You know my reproach, my shame and my disgrace.
⸤Fully known⸥\f + \fr 69:19 \ft Literally “\fq right \ft in front of” \f* to you are all my adversaries.
Reproach has broken my heart and I am sick.
And I hoped for sympathy, but there was none,
and for comforters, but I found none.
They also gave me gall for food,\f + \fr 69:21 \ft Or “they put poison in my food” \f*
and for my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.
Let their table before them be a trap,
and their \add times of\add* peace a snare.
Let their eyes be dark so they cannot see,
and make their loins continually tremble.
Pour out your indignation on them,
and let your burning anger overtake them.
Let their camp be desolate.
Let none dwell in their tents,
because they persecute \add those\add* whom you, yourself, have struck,
and they tell of the pain of \add those\add* you have wounded.
⸤Add guilt on top of their guilt⸥,\f + \fr 69:27 \ft Literally “Give guilt on their guilt” \f*
and do not let them ⸤be acquitted⸥.\f + \fr 69:27 \ft Literally “come into your righteousness” \f*
Let them be blotted out of \add the\add* book of \add the\add* living,
and let them not be recorded with \add the\add* righteous.
But as for me, \add though\add* I \add am\add* afflicted and pained,
your salvation will protect\f + \fr 69:29 \ft The sense is that of making something inaccessibly high, like a fortress \f* me, O God.
I will praise the name of God in song,
and magnify him with thanksgiving.
For Yahweh it will be better than an ox \add or\add* bull,
horned \add and\add* hoofed.\f + \fr 69:31 \ft That is, mature and ritually clean \f*
\add The\add* afflicted will see \add and\add* rejoice.
O God seekers, let your heart revive,\f + \fr 69:32 \ft Or “live” \f*
because Yahweh hears \add the\add* needy
and does not despise his \add own who are\add* prisoners.
Let heavens and earth praise him,
\add the\add* seas and all that moves in them,
because God will save Zion
and build the cities of Judah,
that they may dwell there and possess it.
And the offspring of his servants will inherit it,
and \add those who\add* love his name will abide in it.
